com.stormpath.sdk.application

Class Applications

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stormpath.sdk.application.Applications

  • public final class Applications
extends Object
    Static utility/helper methods for working with Application resources. Most methods are factory methods used for forming Application-specific fluent DSL queries. For example: 
     Applications.where(Applications.name().containsIgnoreCase("Foo"))
     .and(Applications.status().eq(ApplicationStatus.ENABLED))
     .orderByName().descending()
     .withAccounts(10, 10)
     .offsetBy(50)
     .limitTo(25));
    or, if using static imports: 
     import static com.stormpath.sdk.application.Applications.*;

 ...

 where(name().containsIgnoreCase("Foo"))
     .and(status().eq(ApplicationStatus.ENABLED))
     .orderByName().descending()
     .withAccounts(10, 10)
     .offsetBy(50)
     .limitTo(25));
    Since:
    0.8

    • Method Detail

      • options

        public static ApplicationOptions options()
        Returns a new ApplicationOptions instance, used to customize how one or more Applications are retrieved.
        Returns:
        a new ApplicationOptions instance, used to customize how one or more Applications are retrieved.

      • criteria

        public static ApplicationCriteria criteria()
        Returns a new ApplicationCriteria instance to use to formulate an Application query.

        Note that it is usually more common to use the where method instead of this one as the where method usually lends to better readability. For example: 

         Applications.criteria().add(Applications.name().eqIgnoreCase("Foo"))...
        versus: 
         Applications.where(Applications.name().eqIgnoreCase("Foo"))...
        or when using static imports: 
         where(name().eqIgnoreCase("Foo"))...
        While all three statements are equivalent, the second and third examples are shorter and probably more readable.
        Returns:
        a new ApplicationCriteria instance to use to formulate an Application query.

      • createdAt

        public static DateExpressionFactory createdAt()
        Creates a new DateExpressionFactory instance reflecting the Application createdAt property, to be used to construct a createdAt Criterion when building an ApplicationCriteria query. For example: 
         Applications.where(Applications.createdAt().matches("[,2014-04-05T12:00:00]");
        The above example invokes the returned factory's matches("[,2014-04-05T12:00:00]")) method. This produces a name-specific Criterion which is added to the criteria query (via the where method). 
         For example, the following code is equivalent:
 
         ApplicationCriteria criteria = Applications.criteria();
 DateExpressionFactory createdAt = Applications.createdAt();
 Criterion createdAtMatches = createdAt.matches("[,2014-04-05T12:00:00]");
 criteria.add(createdAtMatches);
        Returns:
        a new createdAt-specific DateExpressionFactory instance, to be used to construct a criterion when building an ApplicationCriteria query.
        Since:
        1.0.RC4.6

      • modifiedAt

        public static DateExpressionFactory modifiedAt()
        Creates a new DateExpressionFactory instance reflecting the Application modifiedAt property, to be used to construct a modifiedAt Criterion when building an ApplicationCriteria query. For example: 
         Applications.where(Applications.modifiedAt().matches("[,2014-04-05T12:00:00]");
        The above example invokes the returned factory's matches("[,2014-04-05T12:00:00]")) method. This produces a name-specific Criterion which is added to the criteria query (via the where method). 
         For example, the following code is equivalent:
 
         ApplicationCriteria criteria = Applications.criteria();
 DateExpressionFactory createdAt = Applications.modifiedAt();
 Criterion modifiedAtMatches = modifiedAt.matches("[,2014-04-05T12:00:00]");
 criteria.add(modifiedAtMatches);
        Returns:
        a new modifiedAt-specific DateExpressionFactory instance, to be used to construct a criterion when building an ApplicationCriteria query.
        Since:
        1.0.RC4.6

      • where

        public static ApplicationCriteria where(Criterion criterion)
        Creates a new ApplicationCriteria instance using the specified criterion as the first query condition.
        Returns:
        a new ApplicationCriteria instance using the specified criterion as the first query condition.

      • name

        public static StringExpressionFactory name()
        Creates a new StringExpressionFactory instance reflecting the Application name property, to be used to construct a name Criterion when building an ApplicationCriteria query. For example: 
         Applications.where(Applications.name().startsWithIgnoreCase("foo");
        The above example invokes the returned factory's startsWithIgnoreCase("foo") method. This produces a name-specific Criterion which is added to the criteria query (via the where method). For example, the following code is equivalent: 
         ApplicationCriteria criteria = Applications.criteria();
 StringExpressionFactory nameExpressionFactory = Applications.name();
 Criterion nameStartsWithFoo = nameExpressionFactory.startsWithIgnoreCase("foo");
 criteria.add(nameStartsWithFoo);
        The first code example is clearly more succinct and readable.
        Returns:
        a new name-specific StringExpressionFactory instance, to be used to construct a criterion when building an ApplicationCriteria query.

      • description

        public static StringExpressionFactory description()
        Creates a new StringExpressionFactory instance reflecting the Application description property, to be used to construct a description Criterion when building an ApplicationCriteria query. For example: 
         Applications.where(Applications.description().startsWithIgnoreCase("foo");
        The above example invokes the returned factory's startsWithIgnoreCase("foo") method. This produces a description-specific Criterion which is added to the criteria query (via the where method). For example, the following code is equivalent: 
         ApplicationCriteria criteria = Applications.criteria();
 StringExpressionFactory descriptionExpressionFactory = Applications.description();
 Criterion descriptionStartsWithFoo = descriptionExpressionFactory.startsWithIgnoreCase("foo");
 criteria.add(descriptionStartsWithFoo);
        The first code example is clearly more succinct and readable.
        Returns:
        a new description-specific StringExpressionFactory instance, to be used to construct a criterion when building an ApplicationCriteria query.

      • status

        public static EqualsExpressionFactory status()
        Creates a new EqualsExpressionFactory instance reflecting the Application status property, to be used to construct a status Criterion when building an ApplicationCriteria query. For example: 
         Applications.where(Applications.status().eq(ApplicationStatus.ENABLED);
        The above example invokes the returned factory's eq() method. This produces a status-specific Criterion which is added to the criteria query (via the where method). For example, the following code is equivalent: 
         ApplicationCriteria criteria = Applications.criteria();
 StringExpressionFactory statusExpressionFactory = Applications.status();
 Criterion statusEqualsEnabled = statusExpressionFactory.eq(ApplicationStatus.ENABLED);
 criteria.add(statusEqualsEnabled);
        The first code example is clearly more succinct and readable.
        Returns:
        a new status-specific StringExpressionFactory instance, to be used to construct a criterion when building an ApplicationCriteria query.

      • newCreateRequestFor

        public static CreateApplicationRequestBuilder newCreateRequestFor(Application application)
        Creates a new CreateApplicationRequestBuilder instance reflecting the specified Application instance. The builder can be used to customize any creation request options as necessary.
        Parameters:
        application - the application to create a new record for within Stormpath
        Returns:
        a new CreateApplicationRequestBuilder instance reflecting the specified Application instance.
        See Also:
        Tenant#createApplication(CreateApplicationRequest)

      • verificationEmailBuilder

        public static VerificationEmailRequestBuilder verificationEmailBuilder()
        Creates a new VerificationEmailRequestBuilder. The builder is used when the verification email needs to be re-sent.
        Returns:
        a new VerificationEmailRequestBuilder instance.
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        Application.sendVerificationEmail(com.stormpath.sdk.account.VerificationEmailRequest)

      • apiRequestAuthenticator

        public static ApiRequestAuthenticator apiRequestAuthenticator(Application application)
        Creates a new ApiRequestAuthenticator instance for authenticating API requests for the given application
        Parameters:
        application - The Application for which API requests will be authenticated
        Returns:
        a new ApiRequestAuthenticator to be used for API requests authentication
        Since:
        1.0.RC4.6

      • oauthRequestAuthenticator

        public static OauthRequestAuthenticator oauthRequestAuthenticator(Application application)
        Creates a new OauthRequestAuthenticator instance for authenticating Oauth-based API requests for the given application
        Parameters:
        application - The Application for which Oauth-based API requests will be authenticated
        Returns:
        a new OauthRequestAuthenticator that acts as a builder to allow you to customize request processing behavior
        Since:
        1.0.RC4.6
